service

Class JVSOptionsBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • service.JVSOptionsBuilder

  • public class JVSOptionsBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    Constructs JVSOptions using the variety of setter methods.

    Use this builder to construct a JVSOptions instance when you need to set configuration options other than the default. JVSOptionsBuilder is best used by creating it, and then invoking its various configuration methods, and finally calling build().

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JVSOptionsBuilder()
      Creates a JVSOptionsBuilder instance that can be used to build JVSOptions with various configuration settings.
      JVSOptionsBuilder(JVSOptions options)
      Constructs a JVSOptionsBuilder instance from a JVSOptions instance.
      JVSOptionsBuilder(java.lang.String host, int port)
      Configures JVSOptions to use specified hostname and port number.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      JVSOptions build()
      Creates a JVSOptions instance based on the current configuration.
      JVSOptionsBuilder setBacklog(int backlog)
      Sets a backlog which represents the maximum number of incoming TCP connections which the system will queue internally.
      JVSOptionsBuilder setDelay(int delay)
      Stops the JVS service by closing the listening socket and disallowing any new exchanges from being processed.
      JVSOptionsBuilder setHost(java.lang.String host)
      Sets a hostname or an IP address at which the server will accept requests.
      JVSOptionsBuilder setPath(java.lang.String path)
      Sets a URI path which represents the location of the service on the given host.
      JVSOptionsBuilder setPort(int port)
      Sets a port number that is used by the service.

    • Constructor Detail

      • JVSOptionsBuilder

        public JVSOptionsBuilder()
        Creates a JVSOptionsBuilder instance that can be used to build JVSOptions with various configuration settings. JVSOptionsBuilder follows the builder pattern, and it is typically used by first invoking various configuration methods to set desired options, and finally calling build().

      • JVSOptionsBuilder

        public JVSOptionsBuilder(JVSOptions options)
        Constructs a JVSOptionsBuilder instance from a JVSOptions instance. The newly constructed JVSOptionsBuilder has the same configuration as the previously built JVSOptions instance.
        Parameters:
        options - the JVSOptions instance whose configuration should be applied to a new JVSOptionsBuilder.

      • JVSOptionsBuilder

        public JVSOptionsBuilder(java.lang.String host,
                         int port)
        Configures JVSOptions to use specified hostname and port number.
        Parameters:
        host - a hostname or an IP address like 192.0.0.2.
        port - a port number.

    • Method Detail

      • build

        public JVSOptions build()
        Creates a JVSOptions instance based on the current configuration.
        Returns:
        an instance of JVSOptions configured with the options currently set in this builder.

      • setBacklog

        public JVSOptionsBuilder setBacklog(int backlog)
        Sets a backlog which represents the maximum number of incoming TCP connections which the system will queue internally. Connections are queued while they are waiting to be accepted by the service.
        Parameters:
        backlog - the socket backlog. If this value is less than or equal to zero, then a system default value is used.
        Returns:
        reference to this JVSOptionsBuilder object to fulfill the "Builder" pattern.

      • setDelay

        public JVSOptionsBuilder setDelay(int delay)
        Stops the JVS service by closing the listening socket and disallowing any new exchanges from being processed.
        Parameters:
        delay - the maximum time in seconds to wait until exchanges have finished.
        Returns:
        reference to this JVSOptionsBuilder object to fulfill the "Builder" pattern.

      • setHost

        public JVSOptionsBuilder setHost(java.lang.String host)
        Sets a hostname or an IP address at which the server will accept requests.
        Parameters:
        host - a hostname or an IP address (e.g. 192.0.0.2).
        Returns:
        reference to this JVSOptionsBuilder object to fulfill the "Builder" pattern.

      • setPath

        public JVSOptionsBuilder setPath(java.lang.String path)
        Sets a URI path which represents the location of the service on the given host.
        Parameters:
        path - the URI path where the service is run.
        Returns:
        reference to this JVSOptionsBuilder object to fulfill the "Builder" pattern.

      • setPort

        public JVSOptionsBuilder setPort(int port)
        Sets a port number that is used by the service.
        Parameters:
        port - a port number (1 - 65535)
        Returns:
        reference to this JVSOptionsBuilder object to fulfill the "Builder" pattern.
